      • areAmbiguousHits

        public static boolean areAmbiguousHits(java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> lsiClasses)
        Checks, if multiple hits are ambiguous results. They are ambiguous, if two or more of the hits of the list are not explicitly marked as 'different' by a 'DIFFER=' statment. If true, it is necessary either to eliminiate the ambiguity by 'WIN=', 'WIN=*' or 'LOSE=*' statements, or indicate that the ambiguity is based on real two objects classes using 'DIFFERS=' statments.

      • def

        public static void def(java.lang.String classToken,
       java.lang.String superClassToken,
       int lsiClassNrOffset,
       int maximumSubclasses,
       java.lang.String className,
       java.lang.String[] synonymNames,
       java.lang.String iconImage,

       java.lang.String OSMtags,
       java.lang.String geomTypes,
       java.lang.String closedLineType)

      • def

        public static void def(java.lang.String classToken,
       java.lang.String superClassToken,
       int lsiClassNrOffset,
       int maximumSubclasses,
       java.lang.String className,
       java.lang.String[] synonymNames,
       java.lang.String iconImage,
       int dorendaFlags,
       java.lang.String OSMtags,
       java.lang.String[] properties,
       java.lang.String geomTypes,
       java.lang.String closedLineType)
        Defines a new LSI class
        Parameters:
        classToken - token for this class
        superClassToken - name of the upper class or "" (not null) for top-level classes
        lsiClassNrOffset - either the first digit lsiClass number (if top-level) or the lower digits, added to the upper class number. If 0, the system defines a number
        maximumSubclasses - typicall 10, but also 100, 1000 possible, 0 means: this class must be a class without any subclasses
        className - a user readable name
        synonymNames - a list of user readable synonym names - these are the searchable strings by the symbole search services. [0] array means NOT searable. null object means, the class name is used
        iconImage - the name of the icon image without path and .png
        dorendaFlags - flags to control map rendering (constants see LSIClass)
        OSMtags - sequence of key==value, key!=value, key~=value, separated by ",", right-hand-side "*" allowed, also key=={value1, value2} or key!={value1, value2}. Komma-separated expressions (considered as AND) can be combinded by || (considered as OR). key!= means: there has to be such a key; ~= this key has not to appear, but if must be unequal to the given values. The special value 'IGNORE' is similar to the empty string, but suppresses a warning. 'IGNORE' is used for LSIClasses that are not set by an OSM tag condition. 'WIN=<class1>,<class2>,...;' is used to express that this class should be used as hit rather than <class1>, <class2>..., also +<class> is allowed to express that the entire subtree is beaten. 'WIN=*;' indicates that this class always wins against another hit. 'LOSE=<class1>,<class2>,...;' is opposite to 'WIN=' (also 'LOSE=*;'allowed). Note: 'WIN=*' and LOSE='<class1>,<class2>,...;' can be combined and vice versa. Then, the explicit list is used to reduce the '=*'. 'DIFFERS=<class1>, <class2>...; suppresses a warning if this class and class1... are multiple results of a same query (also DIFFERS=* is allowed, also +<class> is allowed which means <class> and all of its subclasses).
        properties - Array of properies, each of it TYPE:osmkey, TYPE: may be omitted, then STRING: is assumed
        geomTypes - string of "P" (point), "L" (open line), "A" (area or closed line), "R" (relation) e.g "PLA", "L". "*" is equal to "PLA"
        closedLineType - "R": a closed line is considered as ring, "A" a closed line is considered as area

      • generalProperty

        public static void generalProperty(java.lang.String property)
        Defines a general property that is valid for all classes. The syntax is the same as for the def call.
        Note that a general propery must not appear in any class condition.

      • property

        public static void property(java.lang.String property,
            java.lang.String[] classTokens)
        Adds a property to a list of classes. This call is aquivalent to property definitions for these classes in their def call.

      • allLSIClasses

        public static java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> allLSIClasses()

      • bestClassFor

        public static LSIClass bestClassFor(java.lang.String tags,
                    char geomType)
        Returns the best matching LSIClass. null, if there is no best class. An exception is thrown, if two classes are found and the system cannot decide which is correct.

      • bestNclassesFor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> bestNclassesFor(int n,
                                            java.lang.String tags,
                                            char geomType)
        Returns maximum of n best matching LSIClasses. Returns an empty arraylist ist returned (not null), if no hit applies An exception is thrown, if more than n classes are found and the system cannot decide which are correct.

      • allClassesFor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> allClassesFor(OSMTags osmTags,
                                          char geomType)
        Returns all LSIClasses that match a query. If no hit applies, an empty arraylist is returned (not null). Standardflag are used to deal with multipe hits.

      • allClassesFor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> allClassesFor(java.lang.String tags,
                                          char geomType)
        Returns all LSIClasses that match a query. If no hit applies, an empty arraylist is returned (not null). Standardflag are used to deal with multipe hits.

      • allClassesFor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> allClassesFor(java.lang.String tags,
                                          char geomType,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> explainations,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> effectiveLose,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> effectiveWin)
        Returns all LSIClasses that match a query. If no hit applies, an empty arraylist is returned (not null). Standardflag are used to deal with multipe hits.
        Parameters:
        explainations: - if non-null, the result is explained
        effectiveLose: - if non-null: list of effective LOSE combats for each class (i.e. which classes in the LOSE statement actually win against this class)
        effectiveWin: - if non-null: list of effective WIN combats for each class (i.e. which classes in the WIN statement actually beaten by by this class)

      • dorendaBattle

        public static void dorendaBattle(java.util.ArrayList<LSIClass> lsiclasses)
